intro: Maurandella antirrhiniflora, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth surface and a slightly hairy underside. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by birds, particularly hummingbirds.
